dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Cindy. Your friend needs help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I just met her. This is  Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god. Madam Elsa, my psychic,  told me I would meet somebody whose  name starts with a letter of the  alphabet today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? That's amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey girl, that jacket is slamming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better be careful. I heard some  girl got her ass whooped and jacket  stolen earlier today. (off Cindy's look) Hey, what class do we have next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psychology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. 101?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In room "302" at ten o'clock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is too much. I'm gonna have  to play these numbers. Remind me to  pick up a Lotto ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls take a few steps before Brenda grabs Cindy by t arm just as they're about to pass an iron post between th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, don't split the pole. It's bad  luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda walks around Cindy's side and they go on to class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't really believe that stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, TWO OTHER STUDENTS split the pole on either si and are mowed down by a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, girl. After my near-death  experience, I've become very  spiritual. I can feel my angels all  around me, Oh, look a penny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda picks up the penny. They walk past a fountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good luck. Wait, let me make  a wish and throw it in the fountain. (closing her eyes) I wish for a lot of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tosses the penny into the fountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening her eyes) Oh, look, it worked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches down in the fountain and grabs both hands ful of coins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God is good, y'all

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STUDENT walks up a flight of steps through a set of swi doors. He sees Dwight coming towards the doors in his wheelchair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go my man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, pal, I can handle a door by  myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The student let the doors go. They swing, smashing into  Dwight, sending him flying. ANOTHER YOUNG STUDENT rushes help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Let me help you to the  handicapped ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not handicapped! I can use the  steps like anyone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight wheels himself over to the stairs. He successfully navigates one step then goes tumbling violently down the  rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's one more than last week!

dialogues.speaker: TIME LATER
dialogues.text: Dwight and PROFESSOR OLDMAN, 50's, distinguished, are pre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I finished all the interviews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see the files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're on top of the bookshelf.   I'll get them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight wheels himself over to a bookshelf. As he attempts retrieve the folder, the professor moves to assist him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need your help. I'm perfectly  capable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight climbs the bookshelf, reaches the top, and lifts u the folder. Just then, the bookshelf topples over on top Dwight. His hand extends from the mess, holding the folde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, Professor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are these all the subjects?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight, disheveled, glasses bent, gets back in his wheelc and makes his way over to the Professor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. The scored all over the Kiersey  Temperament Sorter just like you  asked for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any of them hot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also took the liberty of putting  those with near-death experiences on  top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thinking, Dwight. Traumatized  co-eds are a sure thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dripping with contempt) As I am sure you are aware, Professor,  subjects who are close to death are  statistically more likely to have  the suggestibility required for  paranormal investigation, which is,  of course, why I've given them special  consideration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, whatever you say, kid, but the  more they're hurtin', the more they  need a squirtin', if you know what I  mean. (then, off Cindy's  picture) Ooh, I like her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy Campbell. Classic abandoned  personality disorder. She seems  guarded, but willing to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willing? I like that. (then, off Ray's  picture) And, this one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Ray Williams. I couldn't quite  figure him out, but he seemed very  eager and excited when we met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor holds up another photo of Ray. In this one, he' got his shirt off and his thumbs hooked in his jeans' poc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's the picture he sent me  after our interview.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Professor continues looking at the pictures and files Shorty, Ray, Brenda, and Cindy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Car accident, gun shot, multiple  stabbings, a hook through the back...  Where did you find these kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are the survivors of the  Steveston County massacre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic. These kids are exactly  the kind of catalyst needed to awaken  Hell House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we going to get them all up  there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make it part of the class. We'll  tell them they're participating in a  study on sleep disorders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what happens when all hell breaks  loose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We record and document it. We're  gonna make history, Dwight. The first  documented, unrefuted evidence of  life after death. The book sales  alone will be worth millions. I'll  be rich, and you my friend, will  have one hell of a thesis paper.   Now, what time is orientation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In about fifteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, Dwight, not a word to  anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy, Ray and a couple of other guys are horsing around. Smiling, Buddy, flicks a guy's ear. Slaps ANOTHER'S hat. They all take it good and naturally return the friendly a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Who laid one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever smelt it, dealt it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy hits Ray in the chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loose nuts. You better hide them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray stands grabbing the guy's crotch. Everyone stops laug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You guys don't know this game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls walk past, interrupting the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, look out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray turns. He and Cindy collide. Her books fall to the gr Ray, not recognizing her, bends down to help her with her things. Their eyes meet. They are both shocked to see eac other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I should have been watching  where I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God, Ray! What are you doing  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the sequel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, no need for you to worry.   All that stuff that happened before  is behind us. Let's just try to move  on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. So just do me a favor and stay  away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy storms into class. Brenda pushes through the guys. She sees Ray. Their eyes  lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Brenda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though guarded, we can see they still have feelings for o another. Brenda hurries into the classroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Professor addresses the class: Cindy, Alex, Brenda,  Shorty, Dwight, Ray, Buddy, and THEO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome everyone. I'm Professor  Oldman. All of you have been carefully  selected to be in this class. This  course is very unique in that each  semester my students take part in a  bona fide study for which they receive  an automatic grade of "A" upon  completion. This semester's study is  insomnia. All of you have some kind  of sleep disorder that we will attempt  to resolve or at least find the origin  to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEO, a striking looking woman who is drop-dead gorgeous, with a body to match, raises her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing) Excuse me, but I don't have a sleep  disorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. You have a "D-cup." You're  in the right place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My assistant, Dwight, will be passing  out directions to everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight rolls over to the desk, picks up some papers, then rolls over to a few steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like me to help you pass  them back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight tips over in the wheelchair and falls hard against the floor. Everyone is taken aback. Crawling, Dwight pass out the papers. Everyone reaches down to collect one from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should arrive no later than 6PM  tonight, and plan to be there until  Monday. That's it for now. I'll see  you all this evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Class ends. Everyone exits. Buddy notices Cindy has left book. He grabs it and goes after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy catches up to Cindy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you left your book back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. I'm Cindy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy hands her the book. The cover reads "Dummies Guide the Paranormal."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I see you're really into spooks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I never date outside my race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant you're into ghosts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. I'm just curious about  that kind of stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it looks like we're going to be  spending the weekend together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we can study together or  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Buddy. You seem really  nice, but I'm just getting over a  really bad relationship, and I'm not  ready to start dating yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy looks disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, hey, maybe we can be friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) Sure, that would be cool. Friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playfully) Okay. See you later, friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to walk away. Buddy notices the top of her pant grabs and yanks them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wedgy!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy hears the ripping sounds and feels the burn. She tu to see Buddy running away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smell you later! Ha! Ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small car drives by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy, singing along with the radio. She sounds terrible. The song stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, will you shut the fuck up and  let me sing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy, embarrassed, stops singing. The song starts up aga Cindy checks the address as she drives up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy's car makes it's way up a long driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy walks up carrying luggage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Door. Cindy grabs the knocker.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL
dialogues.text: The knocker is a set of balls hanging from a bronzed male figure on the door. She slams them hard against the door. No answer. She bangs the knocker again. Still no answer. She pushed against the door. It opens, slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy enters, walking through the house. She makes hersel at home, nosing into things she shouldn't and speaking in general to no one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks over to an answering machine and hits "play."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No new messages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts that down and moves a couple of pieces on a ches board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checkmate. Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a bite off a half eaten sandwich and drinks the last of a glass of milk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She deliberately knocks over a domino and sets off an  elaborate carefully planned layout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anybody here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She digs through the cushions of a chair and pockets some change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was told there'd be somebody here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens a couple of pieces of mail and reads it, then..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Your test results are in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy continues walking through a swinging door and finds HANSON, a well-dressed man, middle-aged, with a short arm and a little hand. He's in the middle of preparing food. holds a meat cleaver in his hand as he turns toward her. Cindy is startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! I'm here with the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Professor Oldman's group. Forgive  me. I didn't mean to frighten you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts down the cleaver, and moves his hand towards Cind face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My aren't you a lovely child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanson strokes her face. Cindy fakes a strained smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tapping her nose) And what is your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy, almost cross-eyed, watching his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Cindy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extending his hand) I'm Hanson the caretaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy reluctantly shakes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll show you to your room. Let me  help you with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the luggage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, that's heavy. I better use my  strong hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the luggage with his little hand. The bag opens, spilling all of Cindy's items over the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. I'll get them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Hanson retrieves the items with his little hand; a  toothbrush, underwear, and other personal effects, Cindy  looks on in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A makeshift lab as been set-up with monitors and other hi tech equipment. Dwight and the Professor discuss the project. Dwight is  wearing a brand new pair of roller blades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have taken care of everything,  including medical supplies and blood  storage. We want to be safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. What about condoms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you're the one who brought up  safety. I'm perfectly willing to go  in raw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you please focus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. (then) What's all this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this measures the amount of  thermal imbalance within a room down  to the tiniest molecular disturbances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Professor is distracted by a bank of monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are those cameras all throughout the  house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I thought that it would be best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even in the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight gestures to a monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, if one of our little chickadees  is taking a shower which one of these  buttons do I press to get a close- up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) That one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After dinner, you and I will take  shifts throughout the night. I don't  want to chance miss anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir, but the students  have started to arrive. Dinner will  be ready shortly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, handyman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the caretaker, not the handyman. (off Dwight's footwear) Nice skates. Be careful. You don't  want to fall and break something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanson exits before Dwight can respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to change for dinner.   I'll see you shortly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good. I'm just going to run  up to my room. Hop in the shower.   Jump into my jogging suit, and I'll  be right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Professor exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy enters. Ray, Shorty, Professor, Dwight, Alex, Brend and Buddy are all already gathered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excitedly) Hi guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely noticing Cindy) Hey. What's Up? Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo enters the room. Everyone stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey guys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) Hi Theo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy approaches Cindy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Hi Buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open chest!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy punches her in the chest. Cindy goes flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta be quicker than that, "A-cup!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy staggers to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, are you boys just gonna stand  there with your mouths open, or is  somebody gonna offer me a seat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy sits just as Buddy unknowingly grabs the chair from under her to give to Theo. Cindy crashes to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Many chairs are pushed in front of her including Dwight's wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL
dialogues.text: Dwight sitting on Ray's lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to his  wheelchair) It's the best seat in the house. I  warmed it up for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo sits next to the Professor. Cindy and Dwight reseat themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor, is this the same house  that a young girl was possessed by a  demon or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it was reported, but never  substantiated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, just like that charges regarding  me and that blind Haitian girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pass me the salt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda tosses a handful of salt over her shoulder. It goe into Dwight's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keepin' evil spirits away. And if  that don't work I always got this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda pulls out a gun and cocks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to worry. There's been no reported  activity in the house for over twenty  years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not forget, folks, this is a  study on sleep disorders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, yes, which reminds me, who here  thinks they'd wake up if somebody  snuck into their room and started  sniffing between their legs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanson rolls in a cart filled with a variety of food,  including a huge turkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough spooky stuff. Let's eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well ain't we gonna bless this food  first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allow me... God is good, God is great,  but not all the time. Sometimes he  could be a real asshole, because it  seems as though every time I try to  establish a relationship with him,  he never returns my calls. I've been  praying for twenty-four years and I  haven't heard his voice yet. Not one  message on my answering machine.  Your miracles don't impress me. It's  your quality time I want. So, if you  hear me, and I know you're up there,  thanks for the food. It's the least  you can do. In Jesus' name, don't  let me get started on him, Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex looks up to see everyone staring in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone care for appetizers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone chimes in their request. Hanson removes the long napkin draped over his arm, revea his short arm and little hand with its stubby fingers. He uses this hand to hold the tray of appetizers. He offers  some to the Professor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finger food?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanson walks around the table with the tray, offering.   Everybody reaches to take one. They realize that the  appetizers look creepily like Hanson's fingers. Cindy bre the tension and reaches for a roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about these buns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they're so warm and soft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray pulls his finger from Buddy's ass. POP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I'll just set them down and  you can help yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone grabs a roll. Cindy takes a big bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ummm!! They smell delicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. I made them by hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone drops their rolls. Cindy spits a mouthful into h napkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The potatoes are just about ready.   Let me just go whip them up real  good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He whips the potatoes. His knuckles dip into the bowl,  covering them with potatoes. Hanson licks his knuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, that's good. Dig in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanson places the bowl on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now for the turkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, what do you say you let me do  that? You just relax. You've done  enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, nonsense. It's my pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanson raises a large knife, then rests his little hand o the turkey to hold it steady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, making a turkey is a real  art. The trick is in the stuffing. A  lot of people are afraid to get their  hands dirty. Not me. When I stuff  it, I like to get the whole hand up  in there. And you know I use a secret  ingredient in the stuffing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanson pulls out a box of "HAMBURGER HELPLESS" with a cri white glove on the box. Everyone moans. Their appetites, ruined as Hanson continu to tear up the turkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's first? Anyone like a wing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yours, or the turkeys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I supposed you'd like a leg. How  about two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: There's only one thing left to do.  You guys, go upstairs and get the  machine ready!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group is gathered. Dwight is strapped to Ray's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone is going to have to lure him  onto the platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy, let me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Buddy, I'm the one he wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I was going to say let me  have your computer if you die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy moves to the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool, but remember, as soon as he  gets on the platform you gotta get  out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody wants to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, let's take a vote...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rest to come... Cindy crosses into the foyer. Buddy, Ray, Dwight, and The stand in the doorway. The machine is gathered at the bottom of the steps. Cindy moves about, yelling to the ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugh Kane, it's me you want, come  get me! I'm not afraid anymore! Show  yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the foyer windows explode. The ghost breaks thr the window. Coming down the steps, he trips and falls. Th ghost rises into frame, stepping on the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prepare to die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you will be mine forever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy stands in the circle. Buddy throws the switch. A digital read-out... 10... 9... 8... 7...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy, get outta there. You'll be  killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do something, Dwight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, she's still on the platform.  If I throw the switch she'll die.  Ahh! No!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With no concern for his safety, Ray, still with Dwight  strapped to his back, bolts towards Cindy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray. He's running in dramatic slo-mo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is he running so slow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, run faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray looks back and nods. He breaks outta slo-mo and speed towards Cindy. Digital read-out... 3... 2... 1... Ray tackles Cindy, hur her out of the way just as the machine's energy field zap the ghost. Cindy, Ray and Dwight hit the ground with a bone-jarring  impact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, you saved my life. Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I broke my fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight, all wuzzy, complains. The force-field turns on and the ghost is instantly in ag He screams. Cindy manages to drag herself to the ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fight it. Let it go. It's time  for you. Rest time. Peace. Carolyn  is waiting for you on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These words make the ghost relax. His evil expression cha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, go to her. You will be together  with her for eternity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brilliant, heavenly light ala the final scene in "GHOST Syrupy music begins to play. The ghost smiles. He places his hand against Cindy's as a kind of gesture of good-bye. Music swells. Ghost rises towards the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Hugh Kane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of yourself, Cindy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, another ghost appears. It's Alex. Ray, Dwight a Cindy turn their heads from the bright light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are, my love. I've been  looking for you. Now we can be  together forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ghost's expression changes to fear. He begins to leav

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you float away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you run from me!... I'm coming  my love!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a flash, both Alex and the Ghost are sucked into the l and disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Ghost goes off to his wretched eternal fate with A in the afterlife, the kids look around at each other. Out the window, dawn is beginning to break. Birds are chirpin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did it, you guys! We made it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang -- Cindy, Brenda, Ray, Buddy, Theo and Dwight -- hug. Shorty wanders into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, y'all! What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shorty! You're alive!! But... what  about your head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That turned out to be a good thing!   It's gonna make smuggling a whole  lot easier. Remember that weed? I'm  about to get paid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy and Shorty hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (triumphant) Come on, guys. Let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the door opens. A ray of blinding sunlight floo the room. Father McFeely enters with some COPS and EMTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid we're too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids watch, confused, as the priest and the officers  rush past without acknowledging they're even there. The k look bewildered. Cop #1 walks up to Cop #2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found one in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COP #3 runs up to Cop #1 and Cop #2, very excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's ass, blood and guts  everywhere!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop #1 gives them the "thumbs up" and walks away without  saying a word. Cop #2 and Cop #3 walk away. On the back o each of their jackets reads "DIRECTOR'S RELATIVE." Then C #1 walks away revealing the back of his jacket, "JUST AN

dialogues.speaker: EXTRA."
dialogues.text: Cindy runs up to Father McFeely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My child, you're alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we made it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We? What do you mean... we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and my friends... You see there  was this ghost. He came out of nowhere  and....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My child you are the only survivor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, my friends are right here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids stand in a group behind Cindy, but McFeely looks right through them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, I don't understand. Tell me  what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon, but first I must bless this  house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McFeely walks off. Ray and Dwight, still strapped to each other, watch the e scenario. They look at the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean to tell me we're dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray undoes his belt and Dwight falls of his back. Dwight  tries to stand up, but even though he's dead, his legs do work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a bus (or car) drives through, smashing Cindy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy sits at her desk talking to someone off screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that we're out of the house and  back at school, I know that  everything's going to be okay. I'm  doubly lucky that I made it out of  the house with you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reveal Cindy is talking to the bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you just shut up? Shut the fuck  up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Oh hi Dad. Yeah, I'm so happy  to be back in college. I love my new  roommate, but I have to say I was a  little nervous at first because she's  so religious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show Megan fucking herself with a crucifix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let Jesus fuck me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan's head spins around, then she spews green vomit and piss everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I got the cutest little parrot.   Birds are such clean animals, he's  no trouble at all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, what do they put in this birdseed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird sprays shit out his ass all over her wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to bother you about this, Dad  but I need you to send me some more  money. For some reason, the college  wouldn't accept the cash you sent  for my tuition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at a stack of 100's that are obviously counterf smeared ink, "One Hundred Dollars" spelled wrong, Ben Fra in dreadlocks. Cindy loads some items into a care package; a copy of "Th Hurricane," a shank, a zip gun, a file, a carton of  cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep checking your mailbox, I'm  sending you a care package. Oh, and  I'm putting in a little something  for your bitch Dwayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts an industrial-size bottle of "Ass-troglide" into the box. There's a knock at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's Buddy! Gotta go! Bye Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy opens the door, and Buddy is waiting there with a b of flowers. Cindy smiles, then punches him through the  flowers, in the chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open chest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy is sprawled on the floor with the wind knocked out him, flowers everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta be faster than that, thimble  dick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy and Buddy exit. Megan keeps spewing and swearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me! Fuck me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl, I wouldn't fuck you if I was  lying in the desert dying of thirst,  with buzzards all around, and your  ass was a water fountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy is pacing up and down the hall, shaking uncontrolla Ray walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo' Tommy, what up, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm totally freakin' dude. I keep  having these nightmares, then I wake  up screaming with these awful back  spasms. I can't take it anymore,  man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aww, man. You just need to chill  out. Come on, there's this party  tonight it's gonna be fun. Lot's of  alcohol and honeys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, but I ain't drinking. and  you're gonna have to look after me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I got your back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray puts his arm around Tommy and they walk off down the  hall. We see a TATTOO "RAY FUCKED ME." on his back. Ray moves h hand and we see another tattoo that says... "AGAIN!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy and Cindy exit the dorm. Buddy stops Cindy on the s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something I really want to  share with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something I want to share  with you too. Here, smell this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy swipes her finger under Buddy's nose. Buddy reacts, and Cindy runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy and Buddy are sitting under a tree together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy, about this whole friendship  thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know, I just love having a  guy for a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but I've been thinking --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) I know, but I've been thinking --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Listen to me I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, what I'm trying to say --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling, fucking  with him) Look, what I'm trying to say --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy slaps Cindy in the back of the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! I'm just trying to say I  think we should take our friendship  to the next level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be your friend like  this anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, walking on the beach,  holding hands, kissing, making love...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds kinda gay, but since  you're a guy, I guess it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get a hot dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get up and start walking. Buddy sees a bee and prote her from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look out, a bee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (charmed) Oh, Buddy, I've never had someone be  so protective of me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what your man is supposed to  do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy and Buddy come upon an ICE CREAM VENDOR busy workin on his cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, wanna' share a soda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Buddy, that's so romantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (then) Can I borrow five bucks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy pulls the cash out of her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What should we get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care. You pick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vendor turns to reveal it's Hanson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Buddy, what are we going  to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. Cindy turns to see Buddy sprinting across th campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it was me all along. I killed  Hugh Kane and his mistress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't I just say that? Fucking  listen. Anyway, I did it all for  Carolyn. He never appreciated her,  but I worshipped that woman and still  she rejected me. So, I came back for  you. Just like I did for Carolyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't be happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you'll be mine, Cindy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanson moves toward Cindy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooo!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM! Hanson is blindsided by a car which misses Cindy by mere inches, but kills him dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHORTY is driving the car, surprised by the thud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A girl with a BAG over her head (the ghoul), lifts her he up off his lap, revealing a hole in the bag through which she was blowing him, as we... FADE OUT.
